node.title: This is what Australian forces will be doing in the Solomon Islands
node.alt: A building stands alight in Honiara amid protests
node.description: Here's why Australia is stepping in on the unrest inÂ Solomon Islands, and what our servicemen and women will be doing in the Pacific nation.
node.content:
["More than 100 Australian police and troops are headed to Honiara, the capital of Solomon Islands, after violent protests led to buildings being destroyed and curfews being imposed in the country.", "The contingent of AFP officers and soldiers will be primarily aimed at quelling unrest in the capital, and will work alongside Solomon Islands police for the weeks-long mission.", "Here's why Australia is stepping in, and what our servicemen and women will be doing in the pacific nation.", "
What will our armed forces be doing?
", "Australia has sent AFP and ADF personnel to Honiara, primarily to protect critical infrastructure and support local police.", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison said an initial 23 AFP officers were deployed \"to support riot control\".", "", "
Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australia's deployment to Solomon Islands will be to assist, and not to intervene within internal affairs.
", "Up to another 50 AFP personnel are being deployed to protect \"critical infrastructure\", however that will not\u00a0include the country's parliament nor high-level government buildings, which will continue to be guarded by Solomon Islands police.", "While 43\u00a0ADF members will be sent to the country, they\u00a0are expected to remain at the airport unless called upon.", "A patrol boat is also\u00a0being sent to the area.", "While the contingent will be armed with lethal weapons, its presence is intended as a peacekeeping force.", "", "
Buildings have been set alight in parts of Honiara.(Reuters:\u00a0Georgina Kekea\u00a0)
", "Mr Morrison said the forces were being deployed to create a stable environment in which internal political issues can be settled.", "The protests in Solomon Islands erupted in recent days \u2014 the main, but not sole, source of the conflict is the government's decision to switch diplomatic allegiance from Taiwan to China.", "Australia's\u00a0deployment is expected to last a matter of weeks, however nobody knows exactly when it will end.\u00a0", "\"We anticipate this will be a deployment for a matter of weeks, but obviously we'll be assessing this on a very regular basis,\" Mr Morrison said.", "
Why is Australia sending help?
", "A bilateral security treaty signed by Australia and Solomon Islands gives the option for the Pacific nation to call on Australia's aid in times of crisis.", "It says that the Solomon Islands government can request\u00a0Australia provide a \"visiting contingent\" for \"assisting in the provision of safety and security of persons and property\".", "It's that clause that was invoked when\u00a0Prime Minister\u00a0Manasseh Sogavare wrote to Australia's Mr Morrison yesterday.", "Australia's involvement in sending aid to Solomon Islands goes back decades, most notably the\u00a014-year Regional Assistance Mission to the Solomon Islands (RAMSI) initiative.", "That\u00a0Australian-led mission aimed to quell violence in the country amid\u00a0ethnic tensions\u00a0and ended in 2017."]
